Art. 4.57. 
Liquidation in the event of a non-unanimous choice 
If some of the heirs accept the succession purely and simply and the others with the benefit of an inventory, the rules of the benefit of an inventory relating either to the form of liquidation or to the right of creditors to sue apply to the entire succession until partition.
In this case, the court may entrust the liquidation of the entire estate to such of the heirs as it sees fit, on condition that the heir provides the security determined by the judgment.
While the liquidation is in progress, none of the heirs may be sued over their personal property. After partition, the effects of the beneficiary's acceptance survive only with respect to those heirs who have accepted in this form.
